page.title: 08A Day at Coleton Fishacre.
page.content: Coleton Fishacre is by the coast.The house is surrounded by beautiful gardens.There are lots of lovely walks along the coast created by the National Trust as part of the Heritage Coastline Project. THE HOUSE The house used to be owned by the D'oyle Carte family who organised the Gilbert and Sullivan Operas.It was built in 1926 of Dartmouth shale taken from the quarry next to the tea rooms in the grounds.The house is now owned by The National Trust and leased by the Palmer family. THE GARDEN We met 7 experts in the garden,they all took a group to teach us something to do with nature.I was in the gardening group,the expert was called Dick Taylor,the headgardener's husband
